title: Czworokąt i symetralne
content: Dany jest czworokąt wypukły $ABCD$. Punkty $K$ i $L$ są odpowiednio środkami boków $BC$ i $AD$. Symetralne odcinków $AB$ i $CD$ przecinają odcinek $KL$ odpowiednio w punktach $P$ i $Q$. Wykaż, że jeżeli $KP = LQ$, to proste $AB$ i $CD$ są równoległe.
hints: Let $O$ be the midpoint of the segment $KL$. What does the condition $KP=LQ$ imply about the positions of points $P$ and $Q$ relative to point $O$?

Consider the point reflection (symmetry) with respect to $O$. Let $s_{AB}$ be the perpendicular bisector of $AB$. The image of the line $s_{AB}$ under this reflection is a new line, parallel to $s_{AB}$. Which known point must lie on this new line?

The reflection shows that $Q$ lies on the perpendicular bisector of $CD$ (by definition) and also on the image of the perpendicular bisector of $AB$. What does this symmetry imply for the relationship between the perpendicular bisector of $AB$ and the perpendicular bisector of $CD$?

The entire geometric setup is symmetric. This implies that the perpendicular bisector of $CD$ must be the image of the perpendicular bisector of $AB$ under the reflection through $O$. What can you conclude about two lines if one is the image of the other under a point reflection?
